Name: The Bilious Cleft
Description: Few Nookfolk swim this deep, where the water is foggier than a London pea-souper. Foul gas bubbles up from the Beast's gut, acidic enough to sting your eyes.

ChildBranches.Name: Down the Writhing Gullet
ChildBranches.Description: This beast is at least centuries old. Its stomach passages are a labyrinth. Who knows what might be lodged in there?

DefaultEvent.Name: Old habits
DefaultEvent.Description: There: the bright light of your zubmarine's main beam. The airlock. Home.

ChildBranches.Name: Time to leave
ChildBranches.Description: Your lungs - unaccustomed to breathing water - begin to labour. You must return to your ship.

DefaultEvent.Name: Quick scavenging
DefaultEvent.Description: You harvest a handful of the nodules. If you mean to venture deeper into the gullet, where there is only darkness and eye-burning waters, you'll need plenty of light.

ChildBranches.Name: Search for Phosphorescent Nodules
ChildBranches.Description: The Nookfolk use them for light, and guard them closely. When they do drop them, though, the nodules sink down here, glowing between the teeth.

DefaultEvent.Name: Naked aggression
DefaultEvent.Description: Wisely, they flee. You cradle the precious glowing nodules. Yours, now. Passing deep-divers catch you eye, pale, and flee. Sensible.

ChildBranches.Name: Intimidate Phosphorescent Nodules from nervous Nookfolk
ChildBranches.Description:
A ragged band squabble over glowing nodules. They stop when you approach, recognising you. They know to be afraid.
[Trade Memories of Nook for Phosphorescent Nodules.]

DefaultEvent.Name: War with the mushrooms
DefaultEvent.Description: The hunters are eager for a blemmigan feast. Their harpoons pierce the mushrooms, and the toothy beasts fight back. The blemmigans swarm, their beaks snapping. Blood clouds the water. The hunters make do with a few skewered prey and retreat, leaving the blemmigans to their darkness.

ChildBranches.Name: Join a Blemmigan Hunt
ChildBranches.Description: The blemmigan you released has flourished down here. Rough-looking hunters with bone harpoons risk the descent in the hope of finding tastier food.
